Svayambhu

Digital Critical Edition and Translation of an Old Javanese Juridical Text

Edited by Arlo Griffiths & Timothy Lubin

  • Witnesses
  • Metadata

List of Witnesses

  • L: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, the Netherlands, Or. 4530: Balinese script on paper, van der Tuuk collection
  • K: Kirtya, Singaraja, Bali, Indonesia, 774 (kropak 3) II A/3/774: Balinese script on lontar
  • M: Kirtya, Singaraja, Bali, Indonesia, 280 (kropak 3): Balinese script on lontar; transcripts HKS 3046; also LOr?
  • SvaMSS: The Sanskrit text as implied by the Svayambhu manuscripts
  • EdO: Olivelle, Patrick. 2005. Manu’s Code of Law: A Critical Edition and Translation of the Mānava-Dharmásāstra. New York: Oxford University Press.

Metadata of the Edition

  • Title: Svayambhu. Digital Critical Edition and Translation of an Old Javanese Juridical Text

L1K1v//0// avighnam astu //0//

1.

Account of Dharma

1.

anuṣṭubh
vyavahārān didr̥kṣus tu brāhmaṇaiḥ saha pārthivaḥ mantrajñair mantribhiś caiva vinītaḥ praviśet sabhām ||

  • MDhŚ08.001
1.1

kunaṅ hulaha saṅ prabhu, uniṅānira taṅ vyavahāranikaṅ rāt, harovaṅa ta sira brāhmaṇa vihikan maṅaji, lavan (1)mantri vruh (2)mavivekā, sulakṣaṇaha ta sira tumamaha riṅ sabhā.

2.

anuṣṭubh
tatrāsīnaḥ sthito vāpi pāṇim udyamya dakṣiṇam | vinītaveṣābharaṇaḥ paśyet kāryāṇi kāryiṇām ||

  • MDhŚ08.002
2.1

(3)haliṅgihāpagəha ta sira riṅ sabhā, taṅanira tṅən hatah (4)ulahaknira, (5)hayvātuduh-tuduh kiva, bhūṣaṇa-pahyasniṅ vvaṅ suśīlātah lviranira, iṅət-iṅətənirātah yogyāyogyani kāryanikaṅ mavyavahāra kalih.

3.

anuṣṭubh
pratyahaṁ deśadr̥ṣṭaiś ca śāstradr̥ṣṭaiś ca hetubhiḥ | aṣṭādaśasu mārgeṣu nibaddhāni pr̥thak pr̥thak ||

  • MDhŚ08.003
3.1

*sari masiha sirān ṅiṅət-iṅəta (6)makasādhanaṅ vara-varah saṅ hyaṅ āgama (7)mānavādi, mvaṅ sakinapagəhaknikaṅ sapañjiṅ deśanya, (8)deśa ṅaranya, sadaṅayan, sajamus vuṅkal, savuravan, sakanuruhan, an hana *kaparǝkanya deniṅ āgama, ya hika deśadr̥ṣṭa ṅaranya, (9)aṅkǝn deśa sasiki svadeśanikaṅ vyavahāra, (10)aṣṭādaśasu mārgeṣu, irikā sthānaniṅ vyavahāra (11)vvalu vlas kvehnya, (12)salviraniṅ vicāraniṅ vyavahāra, hana tinmunya ṅkāna salah siki, (13)paḍa madudva-dudvan viṣayanya.

4.

anuṣṭubh
hiṁsāṁ yaḥ kurute kaś cid deyaṁ vā na prayacchati | sthāne te dve vivādasya bhinno ’ṣṭādaśadhā punaḥ ||

  • This stanza is absent from Balai Pelestarian Cagar Budaya Provinsi Jawa Timur 2020(Hunter 2011(Fletcher 1990(Titi Surti Nastiti 2012(Titi Surti Nastiti et al. 2014(Churmatin Nasoichah 2007(Vernika Hapri Witasari 2011(Vernika Hapri Witasari 2009(“We Have Not Been Unable to Get the File for This Publication,” n.d.(Soutif and Estève 2021–August(“Snapshot” n.d.(Shalihah Sri Prabarani 2009(Titi Surti Nastiti et al. 2015(Furui and Griffiths 2020(“Full Text PDF” n.d.(Zoetmulder 2007(Zoetmulder 1983(Zoetmulder 1950(Zoetmulder 1982(Teeuw et al. 1969(Zoetmulder 1974(Pandit 1874(“44141924.Pdf” n.d.(Pandey 1962–January(“Zenodo Full Text PDF” n.d.’s constituted text, though it is referenced in his app. crit. for one manuscript. The stanza occurs in ed. Balai Pelestarian Cagar Budaya Provinsi Jawa Timur 2020(Hunter 2011(Fletcher 1990(Titi Surti Nastiti 2012(Titi Surti Nastiti et al. 2014(Churmatin Nasoichah 2007(Vernika Hapri Witasari 2011(Vernika Hapri Witasari 2009(“We Have Not Been Unable to Get the File for This Publication,” n.d.(Soutif and Estève 2021–August(“Snapshot” n.d.(Shalihah Sri Prabarani 2009(Titi Surti Nastiti et al. 2015(Furui and Griffiths 2020(“Full Text PDF” n.d.(Zoetmulder 2007(Zoetmulder 1983(Zoetmulder 1950(Zoetmulder 1982(Teeuw et al. 1969(Zoetmulder 1974(Pandit 1874(“44141924.Pdf” n.d.(Pandey 1962–January(“Zenodo Full Text PDF” n.d. 8.4 with reading bhinno, where the Svayambhu implies bhinne.
4.1

(14)hiṁsāṁ yaḥ kurute kaś cit, hana vvaṅ mamātyani nirdoṣa, (15)maṅlarani nirdoṣa, kunaṅ deyam (16)vā na (17)prayacchati, tan paveh irikaṅ yogya (18)vehakna, aveh irikaṅ tan yogya vehaknanya kunaṅ, (19)sthāne te dve vivādasya, ya (20)ikā sthānaniṅ vyavahāra, rvaṅ siki (21)mūlanya, (22)bhinne (23)’ṣṭādaśadhā punaḥ, matmahan ta ya vvalu vlas vkasan.

5.

anuṣṭubh
teṣām ādyam r̥ṇādānaṁ nikṣepo ’svāmivikrayaḥ | saṁbhūya ca samutthānaṁ dattasyānapakarma ca ||

  • MDhŚ08.004
anuṣṭubh
vetanasyaiva cādānaṁ saṁvidaś ca vyatikramaḥ | krayavikrayānuśayo vivādaḥ svāmipālayoḥ ||

  • MDhŚ08.005
anuṣṭubh
sīmāvivādadharmaś ca pāruṣye daṇḍavācike | steyaṁ ca sāhasaṁ caiva strīsaṁgrahaṇam eva ca ||

  • MDhŚ08.006
anuṣṭubh
strīpuṁdharmo vibhāgaś ca dyūtam (24)āhvāna eva ca | padāny aṣṭādaśaitāni vyavahārasthitāv iha ||

  • MDhŚ08.007
5.1

lvirnya: (25)teṣām ādyam r̥ṇādānam, tan (26)kasahuraniṅ hutaṅ, hādiniṅ vyavahāra. nikṣepa, tan kavehaniṅ patuvava. asvāmi(27)vikraya, hadval tan dr̥vya. (28)sambhūya ca samutthānam, tan kaduman ulihiṅ kinabehan. (29)dattasyānapakarma ca, *(30)karuddhāniṅ huvus vinehakən.

5.2

(31)vetanasyaiva cādānam, tan kavehaniṅ upahan. samvidaś ca vyatikramaḥ, advā riṁ samaya. krayavi(32)krayānuśayo, alarāmbəknyān pamlinya kunaṅ. (33)vivādaḥ svāmipālayoḥ, (34)vivādaniṅ *pinaṅvanakən mvaṅ maṅvan.

5.3

(35)sīmāvivādadharmaś ca, kahucapaniṅ vatəs. pāruṣye daṇḍavācike, ḍaṇḍaniṅ (36)sāhasa, vākpāruṣya. (37)steyam, pavr̥ttiniṅ maliṅ. sāhasam, ulah sāhasa. (38)strīsaṁgrahaṇam eva ca, ulah tan yogya riṅ lakī strī.

5.4

(39)... (40)vibhāgaś ca, kadumaniṅ dr̥vya. (41)dyūtam, totohan (42)tan prāṇi. (43)āhvānam, totohan prāṇi. (44)padāny aṣṭādaśaitāni, nahan ta (45)vvalu vlas lvirnya. (46)vyavahārasthitānīha, byakta (47)pinakasthānaniṅ vyavahāra.

6.

anuṣṭubh
eṣu sthāneṣu bhūyiṣṭhaṁ vivādaṁ caratāṁ nr̥ṇām | dharmaṁ śāśvatam āśritya kuryāt kāryavinirṇayam ||

  • MDhŚ08.008
6.1

(48)eṣu sthāneṣu bhūyiṣṭham, ikaṅ vyavahārasthāna (49)vvalu vlas, kapva hana (50)katmunya ṅkana, kapagəhakna saṅ prabhu, yuktinikaṅ vyavahāranya, apan gavayaknanira pagəh i kārya(51)nikaṅ yogya pagəhaknanira.

7.

anuṣṭubh
yadā svayaṁ na kuryāt tu nr̥patiḥ kāryadarśanam | tadā niyuñjyād vidvāṁsaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ kāryadarśane ||

  • MDhŚ08.009
7.1

kunaṅ saṅ prabhu hayva sira gumavayakən ikaṅ kāryāmivakṣa guṇadoṣa, hakona ta sira (52)ri saṅ (53)brāhmaṇa vihikan (54)maṅaji, kumavruhana yogyanikaṅ vvaṅ mavyavahāra kalih.

8.

anuṣṭubh
aṣṭādaśapadābhijñaṁ prāḍvivāketi saṁjñitam | ānvīkṣikyāṁ ca kuśalaṁ śrutismr̥tiparāyaṇam ||

  • This stanza is absent from the constituted text in Balai Pelestarian Cagar Budaya Provinsi Jawa Timur 2020(Hunter 2011(Fletcher 1990(Titi Surti Nastiti 2012(Titi Surti Nastiti et al. 2014(Churmatin Nasoichah 2007(Vernika Hapri Witasari 2011(Vernika Hapri Witasari 2009(“We Have Not Been Unable to Get the File for This Publication,” n.d.(Soutif and Estève 2021–August(“Snapshot” n.d.(Shalihah Sri Prabarani 2009(Titi Surti Nastiti et al. 2015(Furui and Griffiths 2020(“Full Text PDF” n.d.(Zoetmulder 2007(Zoetmulder 1983(Zoetmulder 1950(Zoetmulder 1982(Teeuw et al. 1969(Zoetmulder 1974(Pandit 1874(“44141924.Pdf” n.d.(Pandey 1962–January(“Zenodo Full Text PDF” n.d., though it is referenced in his app. crit. for ms. Ox2 after 8.9. Mandlik (p. 877) and Jha include the stanza at the beginning of Medhātithi’s comment on 8.9; in his notes, Jha (v. 9, p. 490) cites citations of this verse in medieval scholastic works. In contrast with the cases in Div. XX and YY, van Naerssen (van Naerssen 1956) did not notice that the Old Javanese text here implies the presence of this stanza because the Sanskrit original is not quoted.
8.1

(55)saṅ brāhmaṇa saṅ vruh riṅ aṣṭādaśavyavahāra, sira ta saṅ sinaṅguh (56)prāgvivāka, saṅ vruh riṅ aji (57)tarka vruha riṅ śruti veda.

9.

anuṣṭubh
vivāde pr̥cchati praśnaṁ pratipraśnaṁ tathaiva ca | priyapūrvaṁ prāg vadati prāḍvivākas tataḥ smr̥taḥ ||

  • This stanza is present neither in the constituted text of Balai Pelestarian Cagar Budaya Provinsi Jawa Timur 2020(Hunter 2011(Fletcher 1990(Titi Surti Nastiti 2012(Titi Surti Nastiti et al. 2014(Churmatin Nasoichah 2007(Vernika Hapri Witasari 2011(Vernika Hapri Witasari 2009(“We Have Not Been Unable to Get the File for This Publication,” n.d.(Soutif and Estève 2021–August(“Snapshot” n.d.(Shalihah Sri Prabarani 2009(Titi Surti Nastiti et al. 2015(Furui and Griffiths 2020(“Full Text PDF” n.d.(Zoetmulder 2007(Zoetmulder 1983(Zoetmulder 1950(Zoetmulder 1982(Teeuw et al. 1969(Zoetmulder 1974(Pandit 1874(“44141924.Pdf” n.d.(Pandey 1962–January(“Zenodo Full Text PDF” n.d., nor in its app. crit., but is known to have occurred in the Br̥haspatismr̥ti, a text often cited by medieval Indian dharmaśāstra authors. The Old Javanese paraphrase suggests that its author knew the Sanskrit stanza with a reading vicāre for vivāde.

    Brh_1,1.69
9.1

kunaṅ ikaṅ tantraniṅ vicāra, gavayakna rumuhun, sādhana saṅ prāgvivāka (58)matakvan (59)irikaṅ mavyavahāra kalih, vivekanira ta sahurnya vkasan, mataṅhyan prāgvivāka pva ṅaranira.

10.

anuṣṭubh
so ’sya kāryāṇi saṁpaśyet sabhyair eva tribhir vr̥taḥ | sabhām eva praviśyāgryām āsīnaḥ sthita eva vā ||

  • MDhŚ08.010
10.1

(60)haṅiṅət-iṅəta ta saṅ prāgvivāka, (61)hi kāryanikaṅ mavyavahāra kalih, harovaṅa ta sira vvaṅ yogya riṅ (62)sabhā tigaṅ viji, (63)tumamaha ta (64)sirāluṅguhāpagəha riṅ sabhā.

11.

anuṣṭubh
yasmin deśe niṣīdanti viprā vedavidas trayaḥ | rājñaś ca prakr̥to vidvān brahmaṇas tāṁ sabhāṁ viduḥ ||

  • MDhŚ08.011
11.1

saṅ brāhmaṇa tigaṅ siki, paḍa vruh maṅaji, hana brāhmaṇa sasiki prajñān vidagdha, vinidhi muṅgva riṅ deśa saṅ prabhu, ikaṅ deśa papupulanira, (65)yeka deśa sabhā ṅaranya de saṅ paṇḍita.

12.

upajāti
na sā sabhā yatra na santi vr̥ddhā vr̥ddhā na te ye na vadanti dharmam | nāsau dharmo yatra na satyam asti na tat satyaṁ yac chalenānuviddham ||

  • NarSm mā. 3.17/NMS vya. 80

  • dharmo viddhas tv adharmeṇa sabhāṁ yatropatiṣṭhate | śalyaṁ cāsya na kr̥ntanti viddhās tatra sabhāsadaḥ ||

    MDhŚ08.012
12.1

ikaṅ (66)sabhā, yan tan ana saṅ vr̥ddhah tan sabhā ṅaranya, saṅ vr̥ddhah yan tan vruh (67)iṅ dharma, tan vr̥ddhaḥ ṅaranira, saṅ vruh (68)iṅ dharma yan tan (69)agəgvana kajātyan, tan dharma ṅaranikā, kunaṅ yan tan (70)ginavayakən ikaṅ dharma riṅ sabhā, sukət paṅəməh ṅaranikā (71)sahaneṅ sabhā, (72)mapan ikaṅ deśa kinahananiṅ dharma, tan (73)kavoraniṅ adharmi, yeka sabhā ṅaranya.

13.

anuṣṭubh
sabhā vā na praveṣṭavyā vaktavyaṁ vā samañjasam | abruvan vibruvan vāpi naro bhavati kilbiṣī ||

  • MDhŚ08.013
13.1

kunaṅ hikaṅ vvaṅ haṅujarakən prāya yukti, salah denya vkasan, makveh ujarnya, vvaṅ katon (74)doṣanya, ika ta kabeh tan yogya tumamaha riṅ sabhā.

14.

anuṣṭubh
yatra dharmo hy adharmeṇa satyaṁ yatrānr̥tena ca | hanyate prekṣamāṇānāṁ hatās tatra sabhāsadaḥ ||

  • MDhŚ08.014
14.1

mataṅyan maṅkana, dharmanika saṅ uniṅa riṅ dharma, hilaṅ ikā deniṅ adharma riṅ sabhā, (75)kasatyanira maṅkanātah hilaṅnikā deniṅ adva riṅ sabhā, yapvan alah juga dharma deniṅ adharma, halah juga satya deniṅ adva, paḍa hana pva ya riṅ sabhā, (76)patimbunaniṅ kunapa ṅaraniṅ sabhā yan maṅkana.

15.

anuṣṭubh
dharma eva hato hanti dharmo rakṣati rakṣitaḥ | tasmād dharmo na hantavyo mā no dharmo hato ’vadhīt ||

  • MDhŚ08.015
15.1

kunaṅ yan iṅilaṅakən saṅ hyaṅ dharma, malǝs juga sira maṅilaṅakən, yan rinakṣa saṅ hyaṅ dharma malǝs juga sira (77)maṅrakṣa, (78)mataṅyan maṅkana, hayvāṅilaṅakən dharma, liṅniṅ vvaṅ, tan paṅilaṅakən (79)pva kita dharma, tan paṅilaṅakən sira hiri ya, (80)maṅkana liṅ atǝhər (81)pramāṇastava.

24.

  • vyavahārān svayaṁ paśyet sabhyaiḥ parivr̥to ’nvaham || YDh 1.360 = BṛhSm 1.1.106]

    unknown
24.1

maṅkana pva ya, maṅutusa ta sirāmivakṣaha, vvaṅ vruh iṅ āgama, śīghra maṅucapa yan tinakvanan, saṅ makveh (105)kavruhnira śruti veda, paḍaməlakna vataṅan pāt, ikaṅ vet an pamivakṣana*, sakveh (106)saṅ humuṅguh (107)irika, sira ta paḍa umiṅət-iṅəta sarasaniṅ vyavahāra.

(108)maṅkanānakna sajiniṅ vataṅan, apuy riṅ (109)payajñan, kumbha mesya bañu, halalaṅ, (110)sarvavīja, maṇik curiga muṅgva riṅ səṇḍi. tumama pva saṅ prāgvivāka riṅ sabhā, (111)mavḍihana, asalimputa, maṅañjaliha riṅ caturlokapāla, lumkasa ta sira maṅiṅət-iṅəta kāryanikaṅ mavyavahāra kalih.

26.

anuṣṭubh
arthānarthāv ubhau buddhvā dharmādharmau ca kevalau | varṇakrameṇa sarvāṇi paśyet kāryāṇi kāryiṇām ||

  • MDhŚ08.025
26.1

kavruhananira kaṅ ujar adon lavan tan padon, (112)mvaṅ ikaṅ tuhu lavan adva, nahan ta kāryanikaṅ vyavahāra kalih, iniṅət-iṅətǝnira, tumutana kramaniṅ varṇanikaṅ vyavahāra.

yaḥ svāminānanujñātam ādhiṁ bhūṅkte ’vicakṣaṇaḥ | tenārdhavr̥ddhir moktavyā tasya bhogasya niṣkr̥tiḥ ||

  • Our author seems to have known the first Sanskrit stanza with the reading ādhisīmā. It is unclear whether he knew the second at all — whether the phrases after tan ilaṅa ya still concern the first stanza, whether they are a loose rendering of stanza 150 as we know it, or whether they correspond to a radically different version of that stanza. The use of a lowest-level instead of final punctuation after tan ilaṅa ya in all three manuscripts suggests that the scribes regarded what follows as part of the preceding paraphrase.

takvan LK
We cannot make sense of the text as it is transmitted, with takvan, as we require a passive verb form. There are rather numerous occurrences of takvanana in our text and in others, while takvanǝn is scarcely attested anywhere, but we favor this emendation as it seems easier to understand how the error takvan ikaṅ might have arisen from takvanǝn ikaṅ than from takvanana ikaṅ. A further complication lies in the fact that the sequence takvan ikaṅ is attested also in div 28.ikaṅ ulahK

Manuscript L inserts a substantial interpolation between two iterations of the lemma. The interpolation notably contains the full text of MDhŚ 8.139 and an unidentified Sanskrit stanza. Although having stanza 8.139, with paraphrase, in this general part of the text is potentially attractive, the fact that the stanza is quoted in full is suspect, and the precise locus where it is inserted interrupts the paraphrase of 8.137. On these grounds, we favor the hypothesis that the segment of text found only in this witness is extraneous to our text.pirak paṇa sapuluhLK

om. LKM
In order for the arithmetic in this paragraph to work, we absolutely need this sentence to state a quantity of twelve and a half māṣas (i.e., 12 māṣa + 2 kupaṅ). Should we also supply ma before mā? Probably not, as ku in the last sentence is also not preceded by ma. For our author, ma, su seems to have been a fixed combination with ma no longer able freely to be combined with other units, as happens in the epigraphic corpus.2LK

tkaniṁ ṅalaṅanta:raniṁ Ltəkaniṅ aṅalantaraniṁ Mma, su, 9LM
ma:, 1, 9 K6, riṅ sapuluh tahun conj.
A riṁ salek· LKA, riṁ salek· M
The witnesses clearly point to a value of 9 suvarṇas. This means the total number of māṣas in question is at least 144, i.e., a factor of 10 times the annual yield on the loan. For this reason, we conjecture that the number corruptly transmitted as A in all witnesses was a 6, reject the reading riṅ salek despite unanimous manuscript support for it, and conjecture sapuluh tahun. It is not evident why our author would have thought of a ten-year period in the present context, but it may be relevant that this duration will be mentioned explicitly two time not far below (div 130, 132).

Our author seems to have known the first Sanskrit stanza with the reading ādhisīmā. It is unclear whether he knew the second at all — whether the phrases after tan ilaṅa ya still concern the first stanza, whether they are a loose rendering of stanza 150 as we know it, or whether they correspond to a radically different version of that stanza. The use of a lowest-level instead of final punctuation after tan ilaṅa ya in all three manuscripts suggests that the scribes regarded what follows as part of the preceding paraphrase.dravyaniṅLK

Both reading are equally acceptable. We tentatively prefer that with vvaṅ on the grounds of the unanimous manuscript support for ikaṅ vvaṅ mahutaṅ in div 49.pinintonakənyaLK

riṁ K
kunaṅ […] sākṣinya
The readings of both witnesses cannot be reconciled with each other without doing violence to the one or the other. It is noticeable that the reading of K is much more coherent than that of L. By the principle of lectio difficilior potior, L’s’ readings should probably be preferred: they are less consistent, somewhat elliptical, and compressed, whereas K’s readings look like an expansion and systematization. QUOTE K VERBATIM?kunaṅ […] kunaṅ sakaton sakarǝṅə̄ dentasakaR̥ṅəntenta sākṣi, yen tuhu, śīghra
For the paraphrase of the second hemistisch of the Sanskrit stanza, see .kunaṅ […] 2.
The second half of the Sanskrit stanza it not glossed at all. It is likely that corresponding sentences of the Old Javanese text have been lost due to eye-skip.ikaṅ […] yān
All witnesses read a lowest-level punctuation sign here and after the gloss of the next stanza: it seems that MDhŚ08.154–156 were considered to form a group.

^329 . kunaṅ […] sākṣinya] The readings of both witnesses cannot be reconciled with each other without doing violence to the one or the other. It is noticeable that the reading of K is much more coherent than that of L. By the principle of lectio difficilior potior, L’s’ readings should probably be preferred: they are less consistent, somewhat elliptical, and compressed, whereas K’s readings look like an expansion and systematization. ^405 . takvanǝn] conj., takvan LK • We cannot make sense of the text as it is transmitted, with takvan, as we require a passive verb form. A further complication lies in the fact that the sequence takvan ikaṅ is attested also in div 28.

ka, riṅ mavutaṁ yan masaṅketa:, yapva ta mityeṁ vuhus riṁ purvvaka:, ḍaṇḍanika: de bhūpatya, pañca satapa{*}ṇa, kunaṁṅ apuvara haṅasiḥ dvigunotama ḍaṇḍa || ○ ||
anuṣṭubh
nipṭiṁ vak nityaṁ* krodaṣṭaṁ*, valat śobr̥ṁ* namasṭadḍi, niṣṭe maḍyamaṁ* hutamaṁ*, purvvakaṁ* mituva ḍaṇḍaṁ*,
ka, hana ta ya: vaṁṅ apihutaṁ, tinagiḥ pihutaṁnya, tan paveḥ vetan drəvenya, hasr̥ṁ saṁṅ apihutaṁ, maṅalap sadr̥venya, maṅalap histri, sunu, bhūmi, nūn pasu sakalviriṁ patik vənaṁ yata hinalap·, vetniṁ kaṁniṣṭa vinaṅūn mityeṁṅ ūjar,, maka:don hinira:-hira:, haṅiṅindəti, haṅlindihi, tan druḥ kaṁṅ adr̥ve vaṁṅ apihutaṁ, lumka:s kaṅśa:seṁ tan hambava cihna Utər· daL̥m, hikya ṅaran valat sahaṣa havalat śobra, hiṅar:vakən vinalik rantas vitya:, mvaṁ tinibakna ḍaṇḍa mahirantaṁn kaṁ sa:hasobradḍi, kunəṁ pinaraṅgvakna vutaṁ, lavan daṇḍanekaṁ sahaṣa, vnaṅ pasaṅana vrat niṣṭa maḍyotama, ye niṣṭa vit hutaṁ mvaḥ paṅamet· sinahaṣa:, niṣṭa: ḍaṇḍa,, 5000, yen madya paṅamete, ḍaṇḍa, 10000, hutama paṅamete, ḍaṇḍa, 20000, sapaṅamete haṅsula:kna riṁ kaṁṅ avutaṅ, vaṣana, ḍaṇḍa riṁ saṁ bhūpatya || 0 || kunaṁ Ikaṁ pratekaniṁ harta:, sapaṇna:, 20, limaṁ paṇa:, 2, ku, tkeṁ hartha, kunaṁ ikaṁ pirak pana sapuluḥ, ma:, L • Manuscript L inserts a substantial interpolation between two iterations of the lemma. The interpolation notably contains the full text of MDhŚ 8.139 and an unidentified Sanskrit stanza. Although having stanza 8.139, with paraphrase, in this general part of the text is potentially attractive, the fact that the stanza is quoted in full is suspect, and the precise locus where it is inserted interrupts the paraphrase of 8.137. On these grounds, we favor the hypothesis that the segment of text found only in this witness is extraneous to our text.

^620 . mā,] , om. LKM • In order for the arithmetic in this paragraph to work, we absolutely need this sentence to state a quantity of twelve and a half māṣas (i.e., 12 māṣa + 2 kupaṅ). Should we also supply ma before mā? Probably not, as ku in the last sentence is also not preceded by ma. For our author, ma, su seems to have been a fixed combination with ma no longer able freely to be combined with other units, as happens in the epigraphic corpus.

^639 . 6, riṅ sapuluh tahun] conj., A riṁ salek· LK, A, riṁ salek· M • The witnesses clearly point to a value of 9 suvarṇas. This means the total number of māṣas in question is at least 144, i.e., a factor of 10 times the annual yield on the loan. For this reason, we conjecture that the number corruptly transmitted as A in all witnesses was a 6, reject the reading riṅ salek despite unanimous manuscript support for it, and conjecture sapuluh tahun. It is not evident why our author would have thought of a ten-year period in the present context, but it may be relevant that this duration will be mentioned explicitly two time not far below (div 130, 132).

Translation

1

When the king is going to try a case, he should enter the court modestly accompanied by Brahmins and counselors who are experts in policy Now should his Majesty undertake to attend to litigation/affairs of this world, let him take as companions Brahmins who are knowledgeable and study Scripture, and likewise ministers with the wisdom to judge with discernment; with good conduct, he should enter the council.(1)
